title: Olympic National Park: Incident Status Updates
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Management     Fire Management     Incident Status Updates                Current Fire Status       To report a fire in the park, call Olympic National Park dispatch at 360-565-3115. If you have questions and/or comments about fires in the park call the Olympic National Park fire office at 360-565-3120. Thank you.        Godkin Fire, Olympic NP, July 2016 NPS photo   August 8, 2016 Update There are currently four small, lightning-caused fires burning in the Olympic National Park wilderness.  Although there is no threat to visitor safety or facilities at this time, smoke may be visible.      Paradise Fire (2015) The Paradise Fire was located well within Olympic National Park in the Queets Valley wilderness. The fire was caused by a lightning strike in late May 2015 but smoldered undetected until June 14. It was declared out on November 18.       Paradise Fire in Queets Valley, July 2015 NPS photo        Paradise Fire in Queets Valley, June 16 NPS Photo
